subject: SLS
title: Freshman Seminar
info: Topics vary. See Class Schedule.

subject: SLS
title: Freshman Seminar
info: Topics specified in Class Schedule.

subject: SLS
title: Basics in Teaching ESL
info: Current theories/methods of English as second language (ESL) instruction. Methodologies for teaching/assessing listening, speaking, pronunciation, reading, writing skills. Contexts of teaching English to adults in United States/abroad. Internship at school or agency teaching ESL.

subject: SLS
title: Pronun/Grammar,  ESL Teachers
info: Concepts/theories regarding English pronunciation/grammar.  ESL textbooks, teaching activities, lesson plans, curriculum materials.

subject: SLS
title: Practical Language Lrng.
info: Getting a handle on language learning. Having a sense of one's learning/language strategy preferences. Motivation to learn languages in general and a given language in particular. Motivation to do specific language tasks.

subject: SLS
title: Academic Writing in TESOL
info: Research writing conventions in the profession. University rules on ethical use of human subjects, research paper rhetorical structure, literature sources/searches, literature review coherence, hedging markers, basic research methods, research result reporting, APA-formatted bibliographies, writing strategies.

subject: SLS
title: Lang Anal for TESL
info: Overview of the structure of the English language geared to the needs of teachers of English to speakers of other languages. Study the structures of English from the point of view of second-language speakers as well as native speakers. Phonetics, phonology, morphology, and some aspects of the syntax of the English language. Part of a two-course sequence.

subject: SLS
title: Lang Anal for TESL
info: Overview of the structure of the English language geared to the needs of teachers of English to speakers of other languages. Study the structures of English from the point of view of second-language speakers as well as native speakers. More complex structures of English syntax, as well as English semantics, pragmatics, and discourse structures. Second in a two-course sequence.

subject: SLS
title: Res Meth in Applied Lang Study
info: Key issues in second language acquisition/learning research. Focuses on learning a second or foreign language in the classroom.

subject: SLS
title: TESL: Methods
info: Introduction to methods for teaching English as a second language to adults.

subject: SLS
title: TESL: Practicum
info: Observation of, and practice in, teaching English as a second language to adults at college or university level.

subject: SLS
title: TESL: Materials
info: Principles for evaluating/preparing  materials for teaching second languages as applied especially to English as a second language.

subject: SLS
title: Intro to Language Assessment
info: How to engage in meaningful, appropriate, and fair second-language assessment practices; interpret test results; and construct new forms of assessment.

subject: SLS
title: Basics Second Lang. Acquis.
info: Structure of a specific language. Overview of published research on psychology of secondary language learning. Extensive practice analyzing learner language.

subject: SLS
title: Topics: L2 Learn & Teach
info: Topics vary. See Class Schedule.

subject: SLS
title: TESL Seminar
info: Topics related to second language learning/teaching. Focuses on learning/teaching English as a second language. Topics specified in Class Schedule.

subject: SLS
title: Directed Studies
info:
Directed study for teaching English as a second language.
Prereq instr consent, dept consent, college consent.

subject: SLS
title: FTE: Master's
info: (No description)

subject: SLS
title: Genre Analysis/Sec Lang Lrng
info: Critical review of literature on genre analysis. Languages for specific purposes. Focuses on English. Registers used in fields such as engineering, nursing, and business. Students gather data, write research reports.

subject: SLS
title: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (No description)
